PNNL Icon Font

Applications

.pnnl-icon-etre627

Icon for the ETR/Time Billing application. Should be only used when linking to the application or indicating associated content is time billing-related.

.pnnl-icon-connecte610

Icon for the Connect application. Should be only used when linking to the application.

.pnnl-icon-approvalse604

Icon for the Approvals application. Should be only used when linking to the application or indicating associated content is approvals-related.

.pnnl-icon-applause1f44f👏

Icon for the Applause application. Should be only used when linking to the application or indicating associated content is applause-related.

.pnnl-icon-assetse916

Icon for the Assets application. Should be only used when linking to the application or indicating associated content is assets-related.

.pnnl-icon-contract-documentse910

Icon for the Contract Documents application. Should be only used when linking to the application or indicating associated content is contract documents-related.

.pnnl-icon-insighte611

Icon for the Insight application. Should be only used when linking to the application.

.pnnl-icon-industrial-hygienee617

Icon for the Industrial Hygiene application. Should be only used when linking to the application.

.pnnl-icon-info-releasee907

Icon for the Information Release application. Should be only used when linking to the application or indicating associated content is information release-related.

Basics

.pnnl-icon-person1f464👤

A person. Should be used as an indicator on a form control when a user is expected, and as a default profile photo when the staff member has not supplied their own.

.pnnl-icon-group1f465👥

An group of people. This should not be confused with a staff organization, which should use pnnl-icon-org.

.pnnl-icon-orge650

A line organization. Use this icon when referring to formal staff organizations.

.pnnl-icon-phone1f4de📞

The default phone indicator. Use this to indicate a phone number unless the number is explicitly being indicated as a mobile number, then use pnnl-icon-mobile-phone.

.pnnl-icon-mobile-phone1f4f1📱

Indicates a mobile phone number. Unless you know that the number in question is a mobile number or that you are asking the user to enter a mobile number, you should use the pnnl-icon-phone symbol instead of this.

.pnnl-icon-calendar1f4c5📅

Indicates a calendar or scheduled meeting.

.pnnl-icon-emaile625

Indicates an email address or email message.

.pnnl-icon-email-outlinee625

An alternate icon to indicate an email address or email message.

.pnnl-icon-comment1f5e8🗨

Indicates a comment, instant message, or an action to submit a comment/IM.

.pnnl-icon-answer1f5ea🗪

Indicates an answer, or reply.

.pnnl-icon-gear2699⚙

Indicates settings/preferences/configuration options.

.pnnl-icon-gearse901

Indicates operations or complicated processes. Should not be used in place of the single gear for settings/preferences.

.pnnl-icon-print1f5a8🖨

Indicates a printer, or an action to print the current view or a given item.

.pnnl-icon-locatione647

Indicates a specific geographic location.

.pnnl-icon-building1f3e2🏢

Indicates a building, or a facility selection form-control.

.pnnl-icon-home1f3e0🏠

Indicates the primary/entry page of an application or website.

State Indicators

.pnnl-icon-info1f6c8🛈

Indicates that additional information is available, or that content within a neighboring container is informative. Usually used with one of the "-info" Bootstrap classes.

Don't associate this icon with content that requires a user interaction or would be better served with a "-warning" or "-success" class.

.pnnl-icon-helpe63e

Indicates that there's help available, or that content within a neighboring container will help the user accomplish as task.

Differentiating between the use cases for help and info icons can be tricky. Help content should be focused on allowing the user to successfully accomplish the task at hand.

.pnnl-icon-alert26a0⚠

Indicates important information that the user should be aware of, but doesn't require that the user take an action. Usually used with one of the "-warning" Bootstrap classes.

This icon is used in form-controls with the has-warning status.

Don't associate this icon with content that requires a user interaction or would be better served with a "-info" class.

.pnnl-icon-error2bc3⯃

Indicates that an error has occurred, usually requiring user action. A common example is failed validation. Usually used with one of the "-error" Bootstrap classes.

This icon is used in form-controls with the has-error status.

Don't associate this icon with content that is just a warning, save it for critical information.

.pnnl-icon-check2714✔

Indicates completed or successful validation state. Can also be used to link to a validation, certification, or approval action.

This icon is used in form-controls with the has-success status.

.pnnl-icon-check-outline2705✅

Indicates an incomplete validation or approval state. Should be used in combination with the filled check icon, .pnnl-icon-check. See the certification action in the ETR mobile app for an example.

.pnnl-icon-crossmark274c❌

Indicates an invalid or denied state. The opposite of a check mark. Can also be used for a close button.

Text

.pnnl-icon-bold1d5d5𝗕

Toolbar icon for bolding text.

.pnnl-icon-italics1d43c𝐼

Toolbar icon for italicizing text.

.pnnl-icon-heading1d407𝐇

Toolbar icon for creating a heading.

.pnnl-icon-numbered-liste60a

Indicates a numbered/ordered list.

.pnnl-icon-liste646

Indicates a bulleted/unordered list.

Tools/Actions

.pnnl-icon-plus2b+

Indicates the ability to add/create a new item.

.pnnl-icon-plus-circle2295⊕

An alternative for the ability to add/create a new item.

.pnnl-icon-links1f517🔗

Indicates a link to another page, a collection of links, or an action to create a link.

.pnnl-icon-attach1f4ce📎

Indicates a link to attachments or an action to add an attachment.

.pnnl-icon-copye605

Indicates a copy action.

.pnnl-icon-clipboard1f4cb📋

Indicates a paste action, or access to a clipboard storing copied items.

.pnnl-icon-edite622

Indicates an action to edit the associated item.

.pnnl-icon-trash1f5d1🗑

Indicates a delete action.

.pnnl-icon-refresh27f3⟳

Indicates a refresh/reload action.

.pnnl-icon-folder1f4c1📁

Indicates a folder/directory, or a generic collection of items.

.pnnl-icon-uploade670

Indicates an upload action.

.pnnl-icon-downloade621

Indicates a download action.

.pnnl-icon-undo238c⎌

Indicates a undo action.

.pnnl-icon-redoe60b

Indicates a redo action.

.pnnl-icon-search1f50d🔍

Indicates a search action.

.pnnl-icon-full-screene639

Use on buttons that will put the application into a full screen mode.

.pnnl-icon-collapsee61c

Use on buttons that will move the application out of full screen mode.

.pnnl-icon-sharee65f

Indicates a share action. For use on iOS.

.pnnl-icon-share-androide65e

Indicates a share action. For use on Android.

.pnnl-icon-sharinge660

Indicates an item is being shared.

.pnnl-icon-thumbs-up1f44d👍

Indicates an item has been "liked" by the current user, or allows them to show their appreciation of an item.

.pnnl-icon-thumbs-down1f44e👎

Indicates an item has been "disliked" by the current user, or allows them to show their disgust with an item.

.pnnl-icon-disguisee620

Indicates that the current user is impersonating someone else, likely for testing purposes, or indicates the action to impersonate someone.

Sorting/Filtering

.pnnl-icon-sort-arrows-asce61d

Indicates a column/list is being sorted in ascending order.

.pnnl-icon-sort-arrows-desce61f

Indicates a column/list is being sorted in descending order.

.pnnl-icon-sort-arrows-emptye623

Indicates a column/list is not being sorted.

.pnnl-icon-sort-arrows-fillede624

Indicates a column/list is not being sorted.

.pnnl-icon-sort-alpha-asce612

Indicates a column/list is being sorted, or an action to sort, in alphabetical ascending order.

.pnnl-icon-sort-alpha-desce613

Indicates a column/list is being sorted, or an action to sort, in alphabetical descending order.

.pnnl-icon-sort-num-asce614

Indicates a column/list is being sorted, or an action to sort, in numerical ascending order.

.pnnl-icon-sort-num-desce615

Indicates a column/list is being sorted, or an action to sort, in numerical descending order.

.pnnl-icon-filtere634

Indicates an item is being filtered.

.pnnl-icon-filter-outlinee607

Indicates an item is not actively being filtered.

File Types

.pnnl-icon-file-imagee62f

An image file, such as a PNG, JPG, GIF, or TIFF. Use when linking to an image file, expecting an image file for upload, or as part of an export to image action.

.pnnl-icon-file-text1f5ce🗎

A plain text file, such as a TXT, RTF, or MD. Use when linking to a text file, expecting a text file for upload, or as a generic indicator of a written document.

.pnnl-icon-file-worde632

A Microsoft Word document. Use when linking to a DOC or DOCX file, expecting a Word document for upload, or as part of an export to Word action.

.pnnl-icon-file-excele62d

A Microsoft Excel spreadsheet. Use when linking to a XLS, XLSX, or CSV file, expecting an Excel spreadsheet for upload, or as part of an export to Excel action.

.pnnl-icon-file-powerpointe631

A Microsoft Powerpoint presentation. Use when linking to a PPT or PPTX file, expecting an Powerpoint presentation for upload, or as part of an export to Powerpoint action.

.pnnl-icon-file-pdfe630

A PDF file. Use when linking to a PDF file, expecting a PDF file for upload, or as part of an export to PDF action.

.pnnl-icon-file-zipe633

A ZIP file. Use when linking to a ZIP file, expecting a ZIP file for upload, or as part of an export to ZIP action.

.pnnl-icon-file-generic1f5cb🗋

A generic file. Use this icon when there isn't a more appropriate file type icon.

Arrows

.pnnl-icon-chevrone619

This is our default icon for indicating a link to the "next" step, or more information.

This icon is also used in mobile apps to indicate that the row in a list is linked to another view. Both the ETR and Connect applications have examples of this.

.pnnl-icon-left-chevrone643

This is our default icon for indicating a link to the "previous" step.

.pnnl-icon-chevron-downe90b

This is our default icon for indicating the ability to expand a section that is collapsed.

.pnnl-icon-chevron-upe90c

This is our default icon for indicating the ability to collapse a section that is expanded.

.pnnl-icon-arrow-right27a1➡

Use these full arrows to indicate movement, drag-and-drop, or transition states.

.pnnl-icon-arrow-down2b07⬇

Use these full arrows to indicate movement, drag-and-drop, or transition states.

.pnnl-icon-arrow-left2b05⬅

Use these full arrows to indicate movement, drag-and-drop, or transition states.

.pnnl-icon-arrow-up2b06⬆

Use these full arrows to indicate movement, drag-and-drop, or transition states.

.pnnl-icon-arrow-mini-right25b6▶

Mini arrows should be used when a smaller icon is needed for space constraints.

.pnnl-icon-arrow-mini-down25bc▼

Mini arrows should be used when a smaller icon is needed for space constraints. Often used as the caret for dropdown menus.

.pnnl-icon-arrow-mini-left25c0◀

Mini arrows should be used when a smaller icon is needed for space constraints.

.pnnl-icon-arrow-mini-up25b2▲

Mini arrows should be used when a smaller icon is needed for space constraints.

Travel

.pnnl-icon-plane1f6ea🛪

Indicates flight information, or travel in general.

.pnnl-icon-car1f697🚗

Indicates a car, possibly rental car information. Could also be used for general transportation situations.

.pnnl-icon-odometere64f

Indicates mileage, or the ability to update the status of an odometer.

.pnnl-icon-suitcasee665

A suitcase.

.pnnl-icon-lodging1f6cc🛌

Indicates a hotel room or other place of lodging.

.pnnl-icon-meal1f374🍴

Indicates a meal, or food in general.

.pnnl-icon-umbrella2602☂

Indicates insurance, protection, or security.

Charts

.pnnl-icon-pie-charte654

A pie chart.

.pnnl-icon-bar-chart1f4ca📊

A bar chart.

.pnnl-icon-line-chart1f4c8📈

A line chart.

Research

.pnnl-icon-microscope1f52c🔬

The default icon for research activities.

.pnnl-icon-moleculee64d

A molecule.

.pnnl-icon-chemicale618

A flask containing a chemical.

.pnnl-icon-abstracte904

Indicates an abstract, or other descriptor or fragment of a document.

.pnnl-icon-reporte900

Indicates a technical report.

.pnnl-icon-slide-decke909

Indicates a presentation slide deck.

.pnnl-icon-presentatione908

Indicates a presentation.

.pnnl-icon-book1f4d5📕

Indicates a book. The whole book, not just a chapter or other excerpt.

.pnnl-icon-book-open1f4d6📖

Indicates an open book. This should indicate a subsection of a book, like a chapter, as opposed to the entire thing. Can also be used to indicate a reading/textual view as opposed to an audio or visual view.

.pnnl-icon-trifolde902

Indicates a trifold or brochure.

Software

.pnnl-icon-software1f5d4🗔

A generic icon to indicate software.

.pnnl-icon-androide602

Android icon.

.pnnl-icon-apple1f34e🍎

Apple icon.

.pnnl-icon-windowse671

Windows icon.

.pnnl-icon-active-directorye905

Microsoft Active Directory icon.

.pnnl-icon-bug1f41e🐞

Indicates a software bug or defect.

Emotions

.pnnl-icon-emote-happy263a☺

Indicates a positive experience or happy emotion.

.pnnl-icon-emote-neutral1f610😐

Indicates a neutral experience or "meh" emotion.

.pnnl-icon-emote-sad2639☹

Indicates a negative experience or sad emotion.

Miscellaneous

.pnnl-icon-star2605★

Indicates an active favorite, or an action to add an item to a favorites list.

.pnnl-icon-star-outline2606☆

Indicates an inactive favorite.

.pnnl-icon-star-circle272a✪

Indicates a collection of favorites.

.pnnl-icon-heart2665♥

Indicates a heart

.pnnl-icon-heartbeat1f493💓

Indicates a heartbeat, could be used for a literal pulse or to indicate generic health concepts like the application health index.

.pnnl-icon-heartbreak1f494💔

Indicates a broken heart. Can also be used to suggest an error or problem.

.pnnl-icon-aede917

Indicates an AED device.

.pnnl-icon-stethoscopee903

Indicates a stethoscope. Can also be used to suggest health monitoring or checkup.

.pnnl-icon-lock1f512🔒

Indicates a secure/locked state.

.pnnl-icon-unlock1f513🔓

Indicates an insecure/unlocked state.

.pnnl-icon-shield1f6e1🛡

Indicates a shield. Can be used to suggest security.

.pnnl-icon-notification1f514🔔

Indicates a notification or collection of notifications.

.pnnl-icon-camera1f4f7📷

Indicates a photo, or an action to take a photo. Should be used instead of the image file icon when the image is specifically a photograph, like a user profile photo.

.pnnl-icon-video1f4f9📹

Indicates a video, or an action to take a video.

.pnnl-icon-business-cardse601

Indicates a digital contact card, or physical business card.

.pnnl-icon-credit-card1f4b3💳

Indicates a credit card. Could be used to indicate the need for a credit card number entry in a form-control.

.pnnl-icon-badgee603

A PNNL badge.

.pnnl-icon-tag1f3f7🏷

Indicates a tag, either a data attribute or a physical tag.

.pnnl-icon-ticket1f3ab🎫

Indicates a ticket, usually in reference to a service request or project planning issue.

.pnnl-icon-flag2691⚑

Indicates the item has been flagged as important.

.pnnl-icon-flag-outline2690⚐

Indicates the item can be flagged as important, but has not been yet.

.pnnl-icon-truck26df⛟

A truck, such as a lab-owned vehicle.

.pnnl-icon-storage1f4e6📦

Storage.

.pnnl-icon-pin1f4cc📌

Indicates that the user has "pinned" an item in place, or an action to do so.

.pnnl-icon-tools1f6e0🛠

Indicates a collection of tools. Should NOT be used to trigger a menu of actions. Instead use one of the menu classes below.

.pnnl-icon-menu-android-horizontale60c

Indicates a menu of actions that will appear on click/tap.

.pnnl-icon-menu-android-verticale60d

Indicates a menu of actions that will appear on click/tap.

.pnnl-icon-training1f3db🏛

Indicates a training activity or listing of training.

.pnnl-icon-jigsawe600

Indicates a plug-in or extension.

.pnnl-icon-ribbone606

Indicates an award.

.pnnl-icon-laptope642

A laptop/notebook computer.

.pnnl-icon-monitor1f4bb💻

A monitor or desktop workstation.

.pnnl-icon-cloud2601☁

Indicates a cloud service of some kind, possibly cloud/shared storage.

.pnnl-icon-radioactive2622☢

The symbol for radiation or radioactive materials.

.pnnl-icon-fire1f525🔥

Indicates fire or combustible materials.

.pnnl-icon-snowflake2744❄

Indicates a snowflake, or cold temperature.

.pnnl-icon-rsse65a

Indicates an RSS feed.

.pnnl-icon-time1f553🕓

Indicates a specific time, or the concept of historical data. Should not be used in place of the ETR/time billing icon.

.pnnl-icon-sphere1f310🌐

Indicates a generic web site.

.pnnl-icon-contracte608

Indicates a contract.

.pnnl-icon-pute60f

Indicates an action that can be similar to a paste or save. Should not be used to indicate a download. Instead, use pnnl-icon-download.

.pnnl-icon-enter2386⎆

Indicates an enter/log in action.

.pnnl-icon-exite628

Indicates an exit/log out action.

.pnnl-icon-bullseye25ce◎

Indicates hitting a target, accuracy.

.pnnl-icon-fingerprinte906

Indicates a fingerprint, or authentication action.

.pnnl-icon-eyedroppere90a

Indicates an action to select a color, or make another precise measurement.

.pnnl-icon-swatchese913

Indicates a selection of colors.
